headline.print_headline: Court Throws Out Long Island Teacher’s Evaluation Linked to Test Scores
headline.main: Court Vacates Long Island Teacher’s Evaluation Tied to Test Scores

snippet: Sheri G. Lederman alleged that the growth score portion of the evaluation system was biased against teachers whose students were consistently high scorers.
abstract: New York State court throws out teacher Sheri G Lederman's poor rating for 2013-14 school year, calling it 'arbitrary and capricious'; Lederman had sued New York Education Dept, alleging portion of teacher evaluation system is biased against teachers whose students are consistently high scorers; court stops short of ruling more broadly on evaluation system already set to be replaced by state.
